stateCompliance.headline: Understanding Cash Advance Laws in Florida
stateCompliance.content:
Residents of Gainesville are protected by Florida's comprehensive payday lending regulations, administered by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation's Division of Consumer Finance.

Florida law caps single-payment payday loans at $500 with a maximum fee of 10% of the loan amount, plus a $5 verification fee. On a $500 loan, you would pay no more than $55 in fees. For installment payday loans, the maximum is $1,000 with fees capped at 8% of the outstanding balance on a biweekly basis. All lenders must comply with federal Truth-in-Lending Act disclosure requirements.

One of Florida's most important protections is the 'one loan at a time' rule. You cannot have more than one payday loan outstanding anywhere in Florida, and you must wait 24 hours after paying off one loan before taking out another. This is enforced through a mandatory statewide database that all licensed lenders must check. Additionally, loan rollovers and extensions are strictly prohibited.
keyPoints: All payday lenders in Florida must be licensed by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation
You can only have one cash advance loan at a time in Florida
Single-payment loans are capped at $500 with maximum 10% fee plus $5 verification fee
Installment loans are capped at $1,000 with maximum 8% biweekly fee
You must wait 24 hours after paying off one loan before taking out another
Loan rollovers and extensions are prohibited by law
If you can't pay on time, you're entitled to a 60-day grace period with free credit counseling
You cannot be criminally prosecuted for an unpaid payday loan
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: Florida Office of Financial Regulation (OFR), Division of Consumer Finance
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and should not be construed as legal or financial advice. Payday loan laws and regulations are subject to change. This information was last verified on January 15, 2025. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, please contact the Florida Office of Financial Regulation.

faq.question: Where is your Gainesville cash advance office located?
faq.answer: We're at 1205 West University Avenue, Suite 110, right near the University of Florida campus. We're easy to reach from I-75, US-441, and US-27. Parking is available for our customers.

faq.question: What are your hours at the Gainesville location?
faq.answer: Monday through Friday 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Saturday 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM. We're closed on Sundays. Call (352) 555-0189 for holiday hours or more information.

faq.question: Do you offer special options for UF students?
faq.answer: Yes! We understand the unique financial situations students face. We can work with student IDs and other documentation. Call us at (352) 555-0189 to discuss your specific situation.

faq.question: How fast can I get cash in Gainesville?
faq.answer: Most customers receive approval and funding within 30 minutes of visiting our office. You can also apply online first and then visit us to speed up the process.

faq.question: What documents do I need to bring?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government ID (driver's license or passport), proof of income (pay stub or bank statements), and a blank check from your checking account. We'll explain all fees upfront before you sign.
